1 Oh that I were in the wilderness, in a lodging-place of wayfaring women, that I might leave my people, and go from them! For they are all adulteresss, an assembly of treacherous women. 2 And they bend their tongue, their bow of falsehood; and they are grown mighty in the land, but not for truth; for they proceed from evil to evil, and Me they know not, saith the Domina. 3 Take ye heed every one of her neighbour, and trust ye not in any sister; for every sister acteth subtly, and every neighbour goeth about with slanders. 4 And they deceive every one her neighbour, and truth they speak not; they have taught their tongue to speak lies, they weary themselves to commit iniquity. 5 Thy habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know Me, saith the Domina.   6 Therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts: behold, I will smelt them, and try them; for how else should I do, because of the son of My people? 7 Their tongue is a sharpened arrow, it speaketh deceit; one speaketh peaceably to her neighbour with her mouth, but in her heart she layeth wait for her. 8 Shall I not punish them for these things? saith the Domina; shall not My soul be avenged on such a nation as this?   9 For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none passeth through. And they hear not the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and the beast are fled, and gone. 10 And I will make Jerusalem heaps, a lair of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without an inhabitant.   11 Who is the wise woman, that she may understand this? And who is she to whom the mouth of the Domina hath spoken, that she may declare it? Wherefore is the land perished and laid waste like a wilderness, so that none passeth through?   12 And the Domina saith: Because they have forsaken My law which I set before them, and have not hearkened to My voice, neither walked therein;
13 But have walked after the stubbornness of their own heart, and after the Baalim, which their mothers taught them.

 14 Therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink. 15 I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their mothers have known; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them.

 16 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Consider ye, and call for the mourning men, that they may come; and send for the wise men, that they may come; 17 And let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters. 18 For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion: 'How are we undone! We are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.'   19 Yea, hear the word of the Domina, O ye men, and let your ear receive the word of Her mouth, and teach your sons wailing, and every one him neighbour lamentation: 20 'For death is come up into our windows, it is entered into our palaces, to cut off the children from the street, and the young women from the broad places.-- 21 Speak: Thus saith the LORD--And the carcasses of women fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman, which none gathereth.'   22 Thus saith the Domina: Let not the wise woman glory in her wisdom, neither let the mighty woman glory in her might, let not the rich woman glory in her riches; 23 But let her that glorieth glory in this, that she understandeth, and knoweth Me, that I am the Domina who exercise mercy, justice, and righteousness, in the earth; for in these things I delight, saith the Domina.   24 Behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that I will punish all them that are circumcised in their uncircumcision:
